marklogic.body:
Lithium is neither rare nor highly toxic. TRU Group did a study for Mitsubishi the bottom line was the world will soon be overloaded with lithium producers. Together, these producers will end up flooding the market. Given that lithium ion are recyclable (you're not Burning up the lithium) a shortage of lithium is not likely for a long time. Also see http://lithiumabundance.blogspot.com/
Lithium is not toxic unless your ingest too much of it. Lithium is the standard treatment for bi-polar disorder and people have been ingesting it for years - I'm not recommending eating your lithium ion Batteries :-)
